linspace.name: start
linspace.description: The starting value of the sequence.

linspace.name: stop
linspace.description: The end value of the sequence, unless endpoint is set to False. In that case, the sequence consists of all but the last of num + 1 evenly spaced samples, so that stop is excluded. Note that the step size changes when endpoint is False.

linspace.name: num
linspace.description: Number of samples to generate. Must be non-negative.

linspace.name: endpoint
linspace.description: If True, stop is the last sample. Otherwise, it is not included.

linspace.name: retstep
linspace.description: If True, return (samples, step), where step is the spacing between samples.

linspace.name: dtype
linspace.description: The type of the output array. If dtype is not given, the data type is inferred from start and stop. The inferred dtype will never be an integer; float is chosen even if the arguments would produce an array of integers.

linspace.name: axis
linspace.description: The axis in the result to store the samples. Relevant only if start or stop are array-like.

linspace.name: device
linspace.description: The device on which to place the created array.

figure.name: num
figure.description: A unique identifier for the figure. If a figure with that identifier already exists, this figure is made active and returned. An integer refers to the Figure.number attribute, a string refers to the figure label. If there is no figure with the identifier or num is not given, a new figure is created, made active and returned. If num is an int, it will be used for the Figure.number attribute, otherwise, an auto-generated integer value is used (starting at 1 and incremented for each new figure). If num is a string, the figure label and the window title is set to this value. If num is a SubFigure, its parent Figure is activated.

figure.name: dpi
figure.description: The resolution of the figure in dots-per-inch.

figure.name: frameon
figure.description: If False, suppress drawing the figure frame.

figure.name: FigureClass
figure.description: If set, an instance of this subclass will be created, rather than a plain Figure

figure.name: clear
figure.description: If True and the figure already exists, then it is cleared.

figure.name: layout
figure.description: The layout mechanism for positioning of plot elements to avoid overlapping Axes decorations (labels, ticks, etc). One of {'constrained', 'compressed', 'tight', 'none', LayoutEngine, None}
